title: Kyle Sandilands vows to spend his $40million payday on 'junk'
text:
Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson have just extended their contracts with the Australian Radio Network (ARN) and are reportedly set to earn a whopping $40million each over the next five years.

And as news broke of their record-breaking deal on Thursday, the KIIS 106.5 hosts spoke to Daily Mail Australia about how they plan to spend their paychecks.

Kyle beamed as he left ARN headquarters in his $300,000 Bentley Mulsanne, saying he was 'pretty excited' about staying with KIIS until at least the end of 2024.

'Fritter it away': Kyle Sandilands has vowed to spend his $40million payday on 'junk', after signing a record-breaking five-year deal with the Australian Radio Network (ARN) this week

'[Radio] was my first job at 16 years old, I never really did any other job, except a few steps into television. I live and breathe the radio stuff so, yeah, to stick around until 2024, that's great news. And the money doesn't kill either,' said Kyle.

When asked what he plans to spend the money on, the 48-year-old responded: '[I'll] just f**king fritter it away on junk like normal.

'My first radio job was $11,000 a year, so the first half of [my career] was terrible money but it was the only job I knew I could do.'

Monster deal: Kyle and his KIIS FM co-host Jackie 'O' Henderson (right) have extended their contracts with ARN and are reportedly set to earn $40million each over the next five years

'I was told at school there's no career being a smart a** and they were wrong,' he added.

Kyle then offered some advice to young people who dropped out of high school just like he did: 'Kids, be what you want to be, don't let anyone bring you down.'

The Queensland-born shock jock said the secret to his enormous success over the years was partly 'luck' but also hiring the right staff.

Nice wheels! Kyle beamed as he left ARN headquarters in his $300,000 Bentley Mulsanne (pictured), saying he was 'pretty excited' about staying with KIIS until at least the end of 2024

'We've had a lot of luck on our side as well as doing a good show regularly, getting on air with the right people, that's important as well,' he said.

But despite the big payday, Kyle revealed he has no plans to celebrate.

'There's no real celebrating in my life. If I celebrated every time something good happened, I wouldn't be able to even do the job!' he said.

'We're really happy': Jackie (pictured) looked equally delighted as she drove out of ARN headquarters several minutes after Kyle

Jackie, 44, looked equally delighted as she drove out of ARN headquarters several minutes after Kyle.

'We're really happy actually, it's nice to know for the next five years we actually have a job!' she said. 'We've had our ups and downs as a show, that's for sure, so yeah, it's calm waters right now.'

Interestingly, Jackie said that reports she and Kyle are earning a total of $80million over the next five years are 'all speculation'.

Number one: Kyle and Jackie, who have worked together for nearly two decades, have consistently topped the ratings in Sydney's competitive FM breakfast market

'People can only speculate on what figures are, nobody actually knows what our contracts are so they can speculate all they like,' she said.

'More often than not, they're not right, so don't believe everything you read!'

Kyle and Jackie, who have worked together for nearly two decades, have consistently topped the ratings in Sydney's competitive FM breakfast market.

Their latest deal makes them the highest-paid media personalities in Australia.
description: Kyle Sandilands and Jackie 'O' Henderson have just extended their contracts with ARN and are reportedly set to earn a whopping $40million each over the next five years.
authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
